'After eight years on the sidelines, France's Socialists are having their moment'
subhead: Prime Minister François Bayrou's impending downfall stems from his inability to win over the Socialists. They now face a difficult choice between finding an agreement with Macron's coalition or maintaining a stance of radical opposition, observes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: Xi, joined by Putin and Kim, showcases China's military strength at parade
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: To fight Trump, Governor Gavin Newsom trolls, shouts louder and doubles down on bragging

title: Google won't be forced to sell Chrome, US federal judge rules
subhead: Judge Amit Mehta rejected the government's demand that the tech giant sell its web browser as part of a major antitrust case. He instead imposed sweeping requirements to restore competition in online search.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Chikungunya: Ixciq, the first authorized vaccine against the virus, comes under scrutiny
subhead: The US Food and Drug Administration has suspended the vaccine developed by French-Austrian laboratory Valneva. In France, its use has been restricted to people under 65 after three deaths in La Réunion.

title: At the Venice Film Festival, a showcase of men in crisis
subhead: From 'The Smashing Machine' to 'Frankenstein,' the film competition features several works centered on male characters grappling with troubled identities.
byline: By Boris Bastide (Venice, Italy, special correspondent)

title: Arlette Farge, historian: 'Today's isolated and abandoned youth do not know where their future lies'
subhead: 'May '68 Thinkers Reflect On Trump Era' (3/6). The researcher and feminist expresses concern about the early emergence of violence among some young people, as well as about a system of incarceration that fosters repeat offenses.

title: Trump announces 11 dead in US strike on drug-carrying boat from Venezuela
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

Thomas Piketty: 'To succeed in the climate transition, we must redistribute wealth differently'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the French economist explains that protecting the planet from climate change cannot be achieved without reducing inequality.
byline: Interview by Nabil Wakim and Cécile Cazenave

title: French budget minister: 'France cannot go an entire year without a budget'
subhead: With the French government at risk of collapsing, Amélie de Montchalin says in an interview that the deadline to submit a draft budget to the Assemblée Nationale is October 13. Any later and a special law would be required to avoid a shutdown, which she sees as a problematic last resort.
byline: Interview by Denis Cosnard and Mariama Darame

title: 'By challenging the Fed's independence, Donald Trump is taking a dangerous gamble'
subhead: Repeated attacks on the central bank, meant to force it to lower interest rates, in defiance of economic data, threaten financial stability. Disregarding reality for political convenience can have dramatic consequences, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

title: What is Israel trying to hide by imposing a media blackout on Gaza?
